title.native: カードファイト!! ヴァンガード overDress

description:
Yu-yu is a boy living in Kanazawa, Kaga Province. He is 15 years old and in his third year of junior high school. He has the ability to sense the feeling of others, but he is troubled by the fact that he cannot say no when asked. One day, Yu-yu could no longer stand going along with his sister's hobby, so he ran away from home. The one who saves him is Megumi Okura. Megumi invites Yu-yu to a nighttime amusement park called "Wonder Hill" where her friends hang out.

At the amusement park, Yu-yu meets Megumi, Zakusa Ishikame, and Tomari Seto, members of "Team Blackout," a group that meets to play Vanguard every night.

Tonight, a serious fight for the team's flag will take place. Blackout's leader, Danji Momoyama, and the mysterious and powerful fighter, Tohya Ebata. As Yu-yu stares at them, the card fight is soon eroded into a world of images. This is how Yu-yu encounters Vanguard, a world he has never seen before, and is drawn by its powerful allure - making new friends along the way.

(Source: Bushiroad)

Note: The first episode was pre-screened on March 24, 2021 on the official japanese Cardfight Vanguard youtube channel.
synonyms: การ์ดไฟท์!! แวนการ์ด โอเวอร์เดรส

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Wrestling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of wrestling.

node.description: [Website](http://www.clamp-net.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CLAMP_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/clamp_4_official/) CLAMP is an all-female Japanese manga artist group that formed in the mid-1980s. It consists of leader [Nanase Ohkawa](https://anilist.co/staff/97292), and three artists who shift roles for each series: [Mokona](https://anilist.co/staff/100802) (もこな), [Tsubaki Nekoi](https://anilist.co/staff/100804), and Satsuki Igarashi (いがらし寒月). Almost 100 million CLAMP tankōbon copies have been sold worldwide as of October 2007. In general, Ohkawa gets her inspiration for the group from everyday events such as dreams or the news. Unlike most manga artists who specialize in a single genre, CLAMP has created a diverse body of work. CLAMP's genres vary widely, from childish and comedic (Cardcaptor Sakura, Clamp School Detectives) to more dramatic and teen-rated (xxxHolic, X) series. Furthermore, drawing from the idea of Osamu Tezuka's Star System as they did in Tsubasa: Reservoir Chronicle, CLAMP often crossover characters from their own series into their other works, which gives rise to a loosely defined "Clamp Universe".

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!

Akira Ito (伊藤 彰, Itō Akira) is a manga artist. Ito drew Yu-Gi-Oh! R while the creator of the Yu-Gi-Oh! franchise, Kazuki Takahashi, came up with the storyline. Ito's drawing style is similar to Takahashi's. Ito later co-created Cardfight!! Vanguard in collaboration with Satoshi Nakamura (technical advisor for Duel Masters) and Bushiroad president Takaaki Kidani, he is also the author of Cardfight!! Vanguard manga and Cardfight!! Vanguard G: THE PROLOGUE, as well as the illustrator/designer of several cards in the Cardfight!! Vanguard game.

Roselia is an all-girl band in the BanG Dream! franchise. The group consists of five members:
- [Aina Aiba](https://anilist.co/staff/126659/Aina-Aiba) (as [Yukina Minato](https://anilist.co/character/128146/Yukina-Minato)) on vocals
- [Haruka Kudo](https://anilist.co/staff/95110/Haruka-Kudou) (as [Sayo Hikawa](https://anilist.co/character/126259/Sayo-Hikawa)) on guitar
- [Megu Sakuragawa](https://anilist.co/staff/115586/Megu-Sakuragawa) (as [Ako Udagawa](https://anilist.co/character/128144/Ako-Udagawa)) on drums
- [Kanon Shizaki](https://anilist.co/staff/129512/Kanon-Shizaki) (as [Rinko Shirokane](https://anilist.co/character/128143/Rinko-Shirokane)) on keyboard
- [Yuki Nakashima](https://anilist.co/staff/128152/Yuki-Nakashima) (as [Lisa Imai](https://anilist.co/character/128147/Lisa-Imai)) on bass

[Yurika Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/118480/Yurika-Endou) was the previous bassist and voice actor for Lisa up until May 2018, when she retired from the entertainment industry and was replaced with Nakashima.
[Satomi Akesaka](https://anilist.co/staff/95723/Satomi-Akesaka) was the previous keyboardist and Rinko's VA until September 2018, when she was forced to step down after suffering sudden deafness twice, and was replaced with Shizaki. 

Roselia's band name was coined from combining the words Rose and Camellia. They debuted with the song "BLACK SHOUT".

An all-male band in the ARGONAVIS project of the BanG Dream! franchise. It is composed of 5 members: [Masahiro Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/150456/Masahiro-Itou) as Ren Nanahoshi on vocals, [Daisuke Hyuga](https://anilist.co/staff/150444/Daisuke-Hyuga) as Yuuto Goryou on guitar, [Seiji Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/128082/Seiji-Maeda) as Wataru Matoba on bass, [Shouhei Hashimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/134241/Shouhei-Hashimoto) as Banri Shiroishi on drums, and [Shuuta Morishima](https://anilist.co/staff/106743/Shuuta-Morishima) Rio Kikyou on keyboard.

The band was announced shortly before the start of the BanG Dream! 5th☆LIVE. Due to an uproar of worried fans that the characters from Girls Band Party! will have to interact with male characters, Takaaki Kidani, Bushiroad's President, clarified that the male project will not mix and interact with the existing project.

On May 11, 2018, Daisuke, Shuuta, and Seiji  were the first three voice actors to be revealed as part of the project. They announced the joining of Masahiro during their Argonavis 0-2nd LIVE -The Beginning- which they held on September 15, 2018. The last member to join was Shouhei, announced during their Argonavis 0-BEYOND LIVE -The Beginning-.

The name Argonavis is a reference from a large ship named Argo Navis in old Greek mythology, which was a large constellation that no longer exists, as it has been divided into four seperate ones: Vela, Puppis, Carina, and Pyxis, which gathered together and become the ship's head, the Argo. According to Morishima, "Argonavis" is the keyword of the combination of all stars.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shimizukaito210)

Currently affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/Yostar-Pictures). Previously affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/Kinema-Citrus).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._
